agent_utterance: Great question. Quick tweaks for off-schedule days: 1) stay hydrated—carry water and aim for steady intake in the heat; 2) keep 1–2 ultra-simple, portable snacks on hand (apple slices with yogurt or a small handful of almonds) and try to have one near your usual meal time; 3) if you slip, use the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding plus three slow breaths and, if possible, a 1-minute walk outside to reset; 4) keep the log optional and only enable it when helpful; 5) aim for a more regular meal pattern when possible, but allow a flexible 1-hour window around typical meal times to accommodate changes; 6) after a disrupted day, note triggers and adjust next meals gradually to restore rhythm.
